comments: NO DEADLINES! As long as you look over the work and know how to use Google, there is no way you can fail! He does require you participate in discussions occasionally. Also he communicates often with his students to make sure we succeed.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)
comments: I took him over the summer for History of Jazz and Common Wealth of the Arts and let me tell you it was very structured and easy to follow. Note I took both online classes and got a 4.0 by the end of the summer semester. Be in contact with him and be on his good side and if their is a problem he will fix it right away.

comments: I have already tried to take him once before my freshman year and ended up dropping the class because of his lack of communication. He is not willing to work with any student at all, taking it online is a joke because he is trying to teach you music notes, and how to listen to little clips of music and answer questions about them. Don\'t do it

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)
comments: I just started taking MUSC 2000- COTA with this professor. This class is extremely difficult if you have no interest in learning how to read music notes, or listen to songs and understand what notes they are playing. His only grading for the online course is by quizzes, so there is no way to boost your grade. You can not see which answers are wrong

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)
comments: I just started taking MUSC 2000- Commonwealth of the Arts w/ this proff. I really like his grading structure listed in his syllabus. The syllabus says: I count all work equally. That means the quizzes are just as important as the Discussion Board. Good news: You can take each quiz three times with the highest grade remaining on the grade book.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: My least favorite teacher. He asked us to turn in our notes and then gave everyone a failing grade bc they weren\'t good enough. All tests are online, but good luck finding the 2 seconds of documentary footage you need to answer the questions, bc there\'s no book. I somehow passed.. but congrats to him for becoming the worst teacher I\'ve ever had.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)
comments: He seemed like a good teacher at first with no in class tests or finals/midterm. Instead, we did online quizzes that were on documentaries he showed us but the questions were really hard to find from the videos. I thought I was going to fail but somehow I ended out with a B.

comments: One of the best teachers I had. You can tell he loves to teach and he does a very good job at it. The first time I had him was my first time taking an on-line class and I had a very good experience, so I took another class with him. He didn\'t asked for books,so I save some money and he is also funny!

comments: I had him for Commonwealth of the Arts. He is very funny and easy going. Tests are all online. No book used. He shows powerpoints and movies.He is very passionate about everything he is saying. He loves participation.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (2)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  Hilarious (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Caring (1)
comments: This is an online class, so far so good. We don\'t need a book. He posts his own-creation lectures on Bb, which are very illustrative, interesting and fun. No weekly due dates, only finish all by the end of semester. Very passionate in what he teaches, you?ll learn a lot. Never thought I would enjoy this subject. He is a cool teacher.

comments: I had Dr. Beaudoin for Commonwealth of the Arts. He is a good guy and the class was relatively easy. It seems like he is not very confident in his teaching though, although I have heard his passion lies in music. A good guy, just make sure you use your book on the BlackBoard tests.
